review: This is your typical Red Robin restaurant, but my first at this location. The service was ok seeing how very busy this restaurant was on a Sunday evening. I was just surprised that the place was packed. They seemed to have alot of servers and waiters around to make sure everything runs smoothly. I had the bacon cheeseburger which was ok, but nothing very outstanding. It just tasted like any old burger which I could of had at B.K. or Jack in the Box. I'm not sure, but the quality and the size of the burgers have gone down from when I first began going to Red Robin many years ago.  Oh well I guess that is why I could only give them three stars. Very average burger joint.

The burgers just are not as good as they used to be. The fish and chips basket is frozen batter dipped cod that is thrown into a deep fryer. Hard to mess up cod, but they did. It was served to me still raw! The fries were also not cooked all the way through.  Loud as always, and everyone seems to hit this restaurant after or before a movie.. but we really weren't impressed with the food quality. And we have gone here several times..

I've recently been forced to go gluten-free and thought that was going to be the end of my years-long loyalty to Red Robin... after all, a burger is not a burger without a BUN! Three options exist for the gluten-free: 1. Udi's Gluten-Free Bun: $1 upcharge, but surprisingly nice. Very easy to forget that it's gluten-free, and the $1 is reasonable (they are more than that if you buy a bag of 4 at the store). 2. Lettuce wrap. No bun, but they wrap your burger in big leaves of lettuce so you can pick it up and eat it without making (much) more mess than you would with a bun. They have actually offered this for many years for the low-carb crowd. 3. On a plate. No bun, but they put the whole thing, carefully arranged, on a real ceramic plate. It's meatloaf for one! (Don't be depressed about the lack of bread). The server we encountered here was friendly and knowledgeable about all these options. It was busy but she did not betray a single bit of frustration while walking me through my choices. The ticket had ALLERGY ALERT on the top, and they were careful to confirm that my meal was gluten-free when they brought it to me. Depressingly, my beloved sweet-potato fries are NOT gluten-free, but there are enough other choices that I will get over it. Many restaurants would do well to learn a thing or two about serving celiacs from Red Robin.
Awesome place for a casual lunch. Good food, great service and affordable prices.
I really like their outdoor patio. And the new ghost pepper sauce that's available. Red Robin is becoming a go to local destination! Who wudda thunk it?

Bottomless fries! Their burgers are great, can't go wrong with the Gourmet Cheeseburger or Whiskey River BBQ burger and I also like the clucks and  fries. I like to their freckled lemonade (also bottomless) and root beer float (bottomless soft serve!) Came to this location with my family and my burger was cold. The manager apologized, took half off our bill and came back with a warm burger. Very good customer service there.  I love this place, one of my go to restaurants! Also great for groups!

We were celebrating a 21st birthday and it was not acknowledged by the staff after it was mentioned. Had to switch seats 2 times. Wasn't a very friendly staff. It was obvious that the location lacked diversity. Usually why we eat in Bellevue instead of our own neighborhood of Lake Sammamish. Food was cold. Fries were not bottomless. Maybe next time. Probably not.

Hawaii needs Red Robin period! Everytime I go to the mainland, I always have to stop by Red Robin, YUM! Whenever I go to Red Robins I always order a burger. Generally, I order the Royal Red Robin burger, but on my last trip, I changed things up and ordered the Whiskey River BBQ. Let's just say I wasn't disappointed and thoroughly enjoyed the burger. However on my next trip to Seattle, I'm definitely going to eat the usual Royal Red Robin burger. What makes this place great is the bottomless fries and the awesome seasoning salt (can be purchased). I give this place two thumbs up and wished they would bring it to HAWAII!

I typically don't like to get my burgers at diners since it's usually more convenient getting them at fast food restaurants instead. But my friend suggested coming to Red Robin, and I just couldn't say no. This store is decent, and they seem to be kept in fairly good condition. But it's honestly just as average in Issaquah as it is anywhere else. My first encounter with this place consisted of me rushing in to ask the waitress where the nearby Regal Cinemas was. She was helpful, and in fact all the workers I talked to here were pretty nice. I ordered a grilled mushrooms burger with some pink in the middle for $9.99. This was a suggestion from a friend; I'd have no idea what to order otherwise! This was a really big burger, and it was stuffed full of mushrooms! It even looked like there were more mushrooms than meat in it. Accompanying this all was melted Swiss cheese and a nice garlicky taste. And of course, there were also fries on the tray. They were a golden yellow, nice and plump, and showed no signs of being overcooked. I would like to give a higher rating, but it's not like the food was anything spectacular. Fast food has often provided me with better deals in the past. And ten dollars for any burger should mean that the burger is going to be nothing but excellent, but here it was just "A-OK." Still, I may find myself coming here again since my friend mentioned this being a favorite hangout place for her.

I love our local Red Robin, it's simple and quick! After not coming here since middle/high school. We stared coming back every so often when craving a burger and fries. How can you not love the Dirty Bird? The food is consistently good, fast servers, and great fries. It's nothing gourmet, just consistent. Also, they have a surprisingly good happy hour menu in the bar. Enough said...

Although I once HATED this place because I had some rude servers, I've had a couple now that have definitely saved my opinion.  Also, make sure to check the bar out after a Seahawks game, I hear that the players sometimes like to hit it up! I saw Rice there one night after a big win.  Anyway, typical Red Robin with much better service now, and the bartender when I was there was fantastic.
Love this place! I usually go once, sometimes twice a week. Food is always fresh and tasty. Heather is a great waitress and always fast and friendly.

Used gift certificates given by the kids, for an anniversary dinner. Hint: don't do it. M thinks Red Robin is OK, and I do not like them. Too noisy, caters to kids and kids are noisy and shouldn't be allowed out of the house. The food was OK, but the burger I had, the Prime Chophouse, was not worthy of the name or price. M's burger had traditional fixin's and was quite good. The fries were good, and hot. BUT, We had to wait an inordinate amount of time after we ordered a refill on fries. And the refill was quite small. So, yes you get fries, but not gladly, not graciously. So, if you like noise, if you like an average burger for a higher than average rice, this is a fine choice. If you have kids, it's OK, but remember, you're punishing everyone else in the place. Go there again, probably not. OR, if we do, probably have clam chowder (EXCELLENT) and maybe a salad, or just the chowder.

I am complaining about our visit last night, which was awful. The whole time, from when we sat down to when we had to rush out to try to make our movie. We are a family of 6, and dont really take our family out that much. It was a celebration, cuz My husband wasnt working and we wanted dinner before our movie. This red robin is close to the theatre, so we came here. WE HAD A HALF HOUR TO EAT AND GET TO THE MOVIE, WHICH NORMALLY SHOULD BE PERFECT. The server was nice, but she walked around like she didnt care about anything, and especially us .We sat down and it took her a while to even approach us. Her section had one other family in it. She took our drink order, and then we waited so long for her to come back, and take our order. After she took our order and had waited about 10 minutes, no lie, to finally get my husband and I's beer, and my 4 kids drinks.  We asked for fries ahead of time, cuz the kid were very hungry. They took another 10 minutes to get to us. No kidding! So, after the family scarfed the small basket of fries, we sat and stressed that we wouldnt make the movie, and kids were restless cuz they were patiently waiting for now 26 minutes. Our food came. The kids spaghetti didnt have any sauce on it. We asked for more right away. My husbands burger looked good, but I didn't have any food. They asked me what I ordered, and said they were sorry. Meanwhile, We had no silverware. Which was a big problem cuz my kids finally had food, but couldn't eat. I don't really understand why it took so long to bring them silverware either, because the restaurant wasn't busy at all. Anyway, I had to wait for my burger, and they apologized she had forgot it. It came NOT HOW I ORDERED IT, and was COLD!! At this time, I DID NOT CARE ANYMORE. I just ate. I hate complaining. I never do. So I was pretty much the most irritated I have ever been!! So, we had 5 minutes to eat. It was terrible! My kids were s sad we were going to miss the show.  The main purpose we went out last night.  We shoveled it in as fast as we could, I was feeding my 4 yr old, who hasn't been fed like that since she was TWO, just to try to hurry!  The male manager was very nice. He helped with our bill, which we had already asked for.  But, there was no way we were going to pay for this.  All of this happened, which was horrible, but then we all had terrible stomach aches after our meal!!! My daughter was crying cuz it hurt so bad. Mine still hurts the day later!!!! I am sooo entirely unsatisfied and had to tell you. This is unacceptable. TERRIBLE SERVICE!

I often go here during the weekday for lunch and always get the best service in the bar.  We were here for a going away lunch.  We had reservations on a Wednesday at 11am with a  group of 6.  We were seated in the regular dinning area.  We had about 3 different employees stop by our table but the timing of things coming to us were all weird.   -We got our drinks came out all at different times.   -Got our food.  Had no utensils or napkins.   -Asked for refills & napkins/utensils -Got refills.   -finally got utensils and napkins. -Received our bill before any type of signs that we were done with our food. The server then came by to collect our checks without offering boxes or trying to clear off our table.   Experience with the servers were not great.  But I will keep coming back because I love their food.

Of all of the Red Robin's I have been to I would probably say that this one is the best, I didn't give it a four star though because of my order. I ordered the lettuce wrap and when they brought it out to me it had a bun on it. I was also with 7 people, so after they served the rest of the people they said they would take care of my burger. They brought it back a couple minutes later, but all they did was take the bun off and wrap it with lettuce. If I was intolerant to gluten that would have been a great deal to me. Though they made the mistake by putting the bun on they should have made it again without the bun. To top if off when I got the burger it was cold. Which for me I love a warm-hot burger, I'm not going to lie. So overall eh. so so or A-OK.

The service the last three times we have been has been TERRIBLE. The staff is young and inexperienced. They don't seem to care... Little effort is made to make sure your water glass remains full, or if you need refills on your "bottomless" drinks/fries. The food has been less than average - tough to screw up a burger! :( If you are looking for a decent burger/fries, I'd suggest the Gaslamp Tavern (yes, they allows kids) which is behind the McDonalds off Gilman. Better food for the same price.

I was craving some Buffalo wings, so I called in an order of Buzzard Wings® and took them back to my desk at the office. What was inside the box was NOT Buzzard Wings® but about a half dozen wing sections piled on some soggy potato chips. Missing was any sort of carrot or celery sticks.  The wings themselves were not tossed in any sort buffalo sauce, but it appeared that the sauce was drizzled inside the take-out box creating an unappetizing mess.  Most of the wings themselves managed to keep clear from the drizzle and many of them where bone dry. That was a neat trick.  I said to myself out loud, "I'm not eating this." I actually took the order back to complain. The manager explained that they changed the Buzzard Wings® recipe about a month ago and they would be happy to make them the "old way". Fine, I'll take those.  I suggested that since they made so many changes the dish that they should consider changing the name on the menu.  "Well," he confessed. "They are actually now called 'Bar Wings and Chips®'." He added the online to-go menu had not been updated.  This begs the question, when I called in and ordered "Buzzard Wings®", why didn't they take a moment to explain that these had been replaced by "Bar Wings and Chips®"...maybe even explain the difference.... and then add that they could still make either "Buzzard Wings®" or the new "Bar Wings and Chips®"?  Whatever.  Finally got the "Buzzard Wings®" back to my desk. No carrots, but at least there was celery. Thank goodness I ordered an additional side of the red sauce, because like the previous order, many of the wings managed not to have much sauce on them at all.  I finally was able to dig in. A little frustrated, but not enough to warrant a yelp review. I put on my latex gloves (I am hardcore about my wings) and began to dig in.  One thing was immediately clear, and that was that the wings themselves seemed overly processed (in a Velveeta "cheese" sort of way). I don't know how they get them in, frozen, in a can, or freeze-dried, but aside from the bones, the chicken lacked any sort of firmness in the texture. The meat itself was so mushy that it was more like eating an oyster on the half shell. I didn't think it was possible for chicken to disintegrate in your hands so easily once a little pressure was applied.  They texture of the chicken was so baffling, that it could be used as an oddball basket ingredient on an episode of Chopped. I can see the cook on the TV looking at processed wings and thinking, "what am I going to do with THAT?!!!" This is too bad. When I lived in Staten Island there was a Red Robin not too far from my house and I used to go there all the time,  just for the wings! I think back then they were still called "Buffalo wings" and I am quite sure they were prepared with fresh chicken. I guess those days are over at Red Robin.  And while I am at it, I hate, Hate, HATE their ridiculously sized menus. They are as wide and as tall as two football fields. Seriously, they make feel like I am five years old.  The previous time I went to Red Robin I promised myself that I would never go back. I need to start living up to such promises.

Your usual chain restaurant but found it to be better than most of it's kind and prices are reasonable..... We usually go for burgers n have never been disappointed..... But then we only try 1 or 2 that are our faves.......burning love burger is the most go to burger for us..... I usually get it lettuce wrapped n don't even miss the bun.....have also tried whiskey river BBQ, royal red robin n teriyaki burger.......all are pretty decent.... My only ask for them is to salt n pepper the burger patties which are usually bland.....also burgers come with bottomless fries which are thick n crispy......although nthng can beat Teddy's bigger burgers but Kirkland can be a drive from issaquah:)

If you're going to complain about you're food getting messed up maybe you should learn to order off the menu in the restaurant . If you wait 30 minutes for your table, then have the server use half a notebook for your order you are the reason the kitchen is backed up and food is going to take another 30 minutes. when you come in you are not the only table your server has to deal with, understand they are usually working their way through college have been in the business too long and usually hate people by now. and the servers have to tip other people from their sales about 5 - 8 percent no mater what you tip. so when you leave a mess because you can't control your kid, or you eat  like a cave man because "it's not my house i don't have to clean it up"  i came in there not too long ago and heard guest being ridiculous I have served before and have been lucky to move on but some people don't understand the person taking your order is NOT the cook, is NOT the busser and doesn't know how the meat in your meal was raised and butchered they are the middle man that has to deal with everything you decide you like when you're not cooking. This team was awesome I saw them go from quit looking around for what to do, to running around with no rope to save them. Yes they are young, but they don't want to help the guest who can't understand this is their lively hood and a $10 tip on a $60 bill ruins their night because they lost money with you sitting their.

Burgers are awesome, but if you're in the mood for a mixed drink go elsewhere. Ordered a margarita two different times and both were LOADED with sour mix. Tasted no tequila.  Also we sat at the bar which was not busy at all and while the servers were super nice, it was like they were barely around. Other than that super good!

No, just no. What happened to you Red Robin?? I've been frequenting this location for 15 years! I went there last week and was blown away, by what happened. You're not the Cheesecake Factory. I understand wanting to keep up with the "trends" But I come here for a burger and fries, not 5 fries in a metal? cup thingy. I ordered a guacamole bacon burger and it came out with no guac! Then to add insult to injury instead of taking the burger back to the kitchen, I was just brought a side of guacamole for me to put on the burger myself. I thought that was strange and pretty awkward. Oh, don't get me started on the service. Ok, I will get started; I caught my server (I swear) talking about my table to a fellow server considering that his mouth was moving and both were looking right at me. I asked for a side of ranch, and I kid you not, my server walked by and put it on the while still walking- he did not say anything and was just looking forward. I don't even know how he didn't miss the table! I will NEVER go to any RR location. It's too bad that it has come to this, but peace out RR.

I went there with some friends last Tuesday, it was a celebration for my friend Devin. We were in the bar and greeted by a lovely gentlemen that when he got our I.d's he questioned them and was still rude when he found out they were real. Then while having a good time and meeting people you could see him and the bartender pointing and laughing at us. You think they would be smart enough not to point. Then when we had talked to another table he went up and made a joke about us in front of the other table who also thought it was rude. When I went to talk to the manager he didn't take me seriously and he said "its all good buddy" and joking left like I wasn't serious about my dislike of the service. So thank you red robin for solidifying that I will not return. Please get a better trained staff and a manager who cares about the customers. I'm just happy there are more restaurants opening up in the highlands.

Wow. I took a look at all the reviews below and found a similar theme.  This place has some sort of systemic issue with not providing patrons with silverware!  My kids were done eating their pizza by the time my wife and I got silverware for our salads (despite telling the guy who delivered or food when he dropped it off). Probably 8-10 minutes after food delivery.   Same story with salad dressing.   While waiting for the silverware my wife plucked a broccoli from her plate and found a long black hair wrapped around it and another piece. The rest of the food was good one we got to actually eat it.   Our waitress was actually fairly attentive but seemed to have thought the other person who delivered our food was taking care of us.  She had to clean up the mess and did well.  Manager did take care of us when he found out about our issues so I can't complain.  Only reason I bothered to add this was to add to the interesting string of people having issues with silverware.  Bizarre.  Also,  we've had issues with service here in the past (again manager has always taken care of us,  which alleviates the sting and kept us coming back).  I think if they could fix a few processes they would be all good.  Tip: try not to have them seat you by the windows in the back in the winter.  It gets cold.

I am not a fan of this Red Robin. I still go because of the convenience factor, and there is nothing wrong with the food itself, it's as consistent as other locations. But the service here is AWFUL. It is so slow, and the servers are just so apathetic. They will walk by you like 10 times before coming by and acknowledging you, and you can tell they hate their job. When the bar area is full and we are waiting for a table, it will take a good 5+ minutes for someone to even come by and clean one for us to sit down. Never come here if you're in a hurry. We usually come by on Friday nights and ALWAYS sit in the bar area, cuz the rest of the place is packed with children, but it's just pathetic really. I've found the best thing to do is just to sit at the bar, the bartender is bound to give you better service since you are sitting right in front of them then the other servers, or even the managers who roam around acting like they care if customers are happy or not.  They also don't have food specials during Happy Hour either. I don't know if that's a new thing across all Red Robins, or just this location. But I am definitely not a fan of this.  If this place wasn't so close to where I live, I wouldn't step foot in here again. The one at Redmond Town Center is much, much better.

It's a red robin, people. What do you expect? Do not expect 5 star service and 5 star food when dining at a big box chain restaurant that caters to families.  As a parent, this place is awesome. It's loud already so my kids usually aren't bothering anyone with their topic of choice or their meltdown over dropping their apple juice on the floor.  The food comes out quick. Stick to ordering a hamburger or something basic. I've tried many things off the menu and sticking to their specialty is the safest bet.  They have a full bar. On that note, our food  usually comes before out drinks. Even the apple juice comes from the bar so the kids usually have a bit of a wait for their drinks unless your waiter brings you some water.  I wish the drinks from the bar would come out faster.  I think it must be standard protocol here not to seat you with silverware because many people who order a hamburger and French fries can do with out silverware. On that note, I think the servers are usually busy and on auto pilot that you usually have to remind them to bring you silverware if your order something that requires a fork, spoon or knife. We eat here regularly and never have had any problems. The service is good enough and the whole family leaves full and satisfied.

Worst Red Robin I've ever been to! Over cooked food, no drink refills offered, mistakes on order, bad service, bad food and no rewards service and I'm a huge Red Robin fan. We had to take one of our meals to go because it took so long to get it right but at least they comped it. Get it together guys!
Red Robin UMMM!! I love the burgers and the freckled lemonade!

We go to Red Robin because my kids love burgers and RR is one of the only places that serves GF Burgers.  I do have to say their waitstaff is hit or miss sometimes you get a great server other times you want to pull your hair out. Overall its a fun fast atmosphere and great for GF sensitivities.

This is a place my wife and her friends with kids go often.  Now that the "kids" order off the adult menu, it gets pricey for what you get.  I don't mind RR when on the road as the company pays for it, but all in all, it fails the cost to benefit ratio.  This location is in desperate need for a refresh.  I have now isolated the smell when you walk in to a combo of the lake outside and dirty diapers.  Service can be spotty and food often comes cold.  At least they ask if you want fries refilled - but again - they come cold.  If you and your "fan" are looking for a place in Issy, the is is one of your few choices.  I will be back as until more opens up nearby - you know what you are getting and it has its moments of glory.

This is my local Red Robin and I love it. The food is just like any other Red Robin and the location is a little hard to get to, but all in all it's a great place. I go for the burgers and fries, so I can't comment on anything else. I've never had a burger at Red Robin that isn't amazing. Also...how can you not love bottomless fries. I just recently found about the campfire sauce, an incredible chipotle fry sauce, and it changed my life forever. Please, please ask for campfire sauce. It will add so much happiness to your life. Anyway. If you go on a Friday or Saturday night,the wait time can be pretty long...I'm really craving some fries now. The Whiskey River BBQ Burger is really good, also the Guacamole Bacon Burger. Most burgers (including bottomless fries) are about $10.

Worst experience here today. Took 45 mins for the food to come, the waitress said we were close but waiting on the last dish which was taking longer. Once it did arrive, we realized it was all cold already. I'm assuming this is because the rest of the food was left to get cold while waiting for that last dish. Unacceptable. Also had to ask for napkins which should have been supplied to begin with.

Unfortunately, the service and "little extras" seem to be missing from the Red Robin I once knew. I know these places have fairly regular changes in management and boy, is it noticeable. It's really too bad. We used to love going here.

Very disappointed on our last visit.  Our server forgot our drinks so they arrived at the same time as our food. When I asked for some silverware he went off to find some and left me waiting while he processed another tables check and delivered two others before bringing over a fork and knife. We were never offered refills on our drinks or fries. And while clearing dishes from the table, the server hit my husband's beer glass and almost knocked the entire beer onto our 4 year old. All in all, we felt like we were an inconvenience to the staff and talked down to by someone half our age. There are so many better burger places out there and we intend to find more of them!

Solid meh. I know it's a chain and my expectations are tailored as such, but I've been to countless Red Robins across multiple states (probably shouldn't be proud of that) and this was one of the worse I've been to. Consistency is completely lacking at this particular Issaquah Red Robin, and I was really disappointed.  It's not hard to make a Whiskey River barbecue chicken salad, and all other Red Robins seem to have no problem with this maddeningly simple recipe. But this Red Robin somehow forgot to put the salad's very namesake barbecue sauce on the salad, which left me with a completely dry bed of wilted, brown lettuce, some fatty chicken breast, and other forgettable ingredients. They also forgot the avocado which, if I were queen, would he punishable by death.  Everything else we had was either wrong or completely forgettable. I usually love Red Robin and know their menu well. I also know how their meals are supposed to taste (aka their French Onion Soup should actually NOT taste like dirty sock water). But this particular location just doesn't hit the consistency mark on their decades' old recipes, and it's really sad.  Service is also maddeningly slow, and food comes out way too long after ordering. 2 stars only because our server, despite the slow motion pace of the kitchen, was super friendly, attentive, and nice. Good job on that.

When I eat here I always feel like I'm getting my full week's worth of grease and salt. Unfortunately my wife seems to want to go here every time the opportunity presents itself. Our kids love the concept of going here. I suppose it's always better to go to a restaurant than to go home for lunch, right? When we actually put the food before them they have a hard time eating it. They do like the balloons.

I like Red Robin because of all the GREAT food it has. Like Macaroni, french fries, soda pop, kids menus, Red the bird, balloons, and you usually don't have to wait very long for a table. It's awesome! (Kaitlyn, 8 yrs old)

This place is good for a dinner with kids. The food is good enough, but I've been really unlucky with getting cold burgers the last couple of times I've been there. The other problem is the 'bottomless fries'. Each time I've been there we have to beg and plead for refills, and they are super slow in coming if they come at all. Besides those little problems, I will return. The customer service is good. The manager always comes out with the replacement hot burger to apologize personally. I like the location, menu, and (most times) the staff, and they have a really nice outside eating area which is great for an afternoon lunch.

I went through four glasses of Iced Tea to finish my  Fiery Ghost Style Tavern Burger. The double beef patty sandwich includes ghost pepper sauce, pepper jack cheese, fresh-cut and fried jalapeños. I don't know of a spicier burger found at a chain restaurant. Aren't they worried about liability?  Perhaps it's on the menu to sell more Mountain High Ice Cream Mud Pie.

Another successful afternoon at Red Robin! This place is always busy and full of families - especially in the evenings. But my favorite is to come here for a nice afternoon lunch!  It's close to so many of our favorite stores so it seems so convenient - on the way to Costco, the Issaquah Farmer's Market, Lowes, PetSmart, Pier One, Big Lots, Office Depot... The list goes on! This restaurant is just plain close to everything.  Today we had Ryan and Josh waiting on us - they totally rock! Quick to seat us deliver food and drink and they handled my garden patty substitution request easily. They were polite and prompt with refills but they didn't hover, A+ waitstaff!  Another reason I like this restaurant - especially on nice days, is it's proximity to Lake Costco. It's right off the main trail a s the back patio has gorgeous views of the park.  Little known fact... The International Headquarters for Costco Corporate is next door - here in Pickering Place. And they built a beautiful lake! Lots of trails, park benches, a cool bridge and beautiful fountain. Lake Costco is open to the public and a beautiful place to wander and work off that burger you just inhaled at Red Robin!

It was such a hot night, so we looked for someplace close with A/C so Red Robin it was. It was around 7, and the waiting area was packed. Luckily, there were open tables in the bar so we didn't have to wait. We got a couple of drinks, onion rings, royal burger (with an egg) and a BBQ chicken burger. Nothing incredible, but good nonetheless. We also got good service from the waitress, so that is always a plus.

Every time I come here, I am so disappointed with the service. I always forget why I don't come here more often, until I walk through the door. The host is never there, their servers are RUDE! I only come here for their fries. Maybe I will start driving all the way to bellevue for better service.

After over a year we came here because we were tired to drive to downtown Bellevue. One family of three came before us and I heard the hostess tell them it will be 10-15 minutes. The lady said "Really?". The hostess informed her that there were not enough staff. When I looked it was almost empty and it was not that late. When she asked us we said 5 but then I realized we were 4. Who cares. The hostess looked like she was working in a crowded restaurant but it was not which was weird why she looked so tired. When she called us I see her taking the menus and when  I told her "Sorry we are 4". She made a face. Ridiculous.  When she sat us down she almost was throwing the menus on the table. Then after a minute or so she sat this other party in front of us and she placed the menus nicely and even asked them for water, she did not for us. Who knows why she will behave like that with us. The waiter was nice. He seemed also stressed but he was nice to us and asked us immediately for our drinks. I will not be coming back to this restaurant. This is the second time I see an attitude from a hostess. Two stars as I have experienced better. Blah.
They've always been consistent with the burgers I ordered.  Location is a bit hard to find.

We have gone to the Issiquah red robin several times.  We go because we have two sons  (5 and 6) who plead and beg us to go. Red Robin causes this appeal by directly advertising to kids with cartoons, a colorful decor, a fun atmosphere and child oriented foods. I visited this past week with just one son and my wife.  The lowered supervisory demands allowed me more time to take in the dining room. I have always thought  that this location was a little worn: scratches on floors and tables, and a general appearance of be ng a frequently used restaurant. What I had failed to notice where the scaly and gross feeling of caked on grease, food and a unknown but likely fearsome collection of bacteria and the variety of other detritus that customers may have on their hands upon returning from the bathroom.  Not only did I find gross muck on the chairs, but also found it on the tables, walls and floors.  There were corners on the floor where there such a significant buildup of filth it looked like a grey and brown, nightmare inducing snow drift. The fresh cutlery, hopefully we're clean, but there looked to be some substance on them. I forced myself to believe they were water stains.  The devices they used to present appetizers were chipped and rusted, likely serving as a breeding ground  for the gross population of microbes in the dining area. I am not the first to suggest this, as I googled filthy "red robin" and there were no shortage of complaints from a variety of sources. Try it yourself. I can live with filth and eating around it, but I bring my kids to this place as do other parents. Seniors are just as vulnerable to bood born disease as  young children, and Red Robin directly appeals to this most at risk demographic  (grand parents and children). Red Robin is quite aware of taco diction of their dining rooms (how can they not be, considering the volume of complaints available on the internet). Failing to create an at least visual attempt at sanitary practice, clearly shows that they are content to  take money from those they harm. At the very least Red Robin shows a lazy contempt for their customers. However knowing that this company has the years of operational experience but not the will to keep their dining room clean, Red Robin comfortably joins the ranks with Comcast as an evil  company. TL/DR - the restauant is a gross nightmare. Avoid bringing the young and old there  to avoid the likelihood of food borne illness. ps - took some pictures on the sly.  Will post if I can figure out a way.

Always love going to Red Robin, not just for the wonderful food but enjoy the special attention and service from our favorite server Brian T and the General Manager Jerry at the Grapevine,Texas location.  JB

Went there recently with my family for lunch. We ended up sitting in the bar (perks of all being over 21). I've had bad experiences with the red robins at the factoria location in the past. But I figured I'd give this new location I've never been to a try again. Waitress was alright, nothing spectacular. The food was the breaking point for me. I had ordered a wrap and side salad. Nothing out of the ordinary or a new option for red robin. The salad was brown and pink and looked disgusting. I picked out the bad lettuce eating what looked edible. The wrap was drenched in sauce probably covering the fact it was old too. The chicken was chewy and not in a good way, more of a rubbery, old taste. My mothers burger also had old lettuce in it as well. We told the waitress and she didn't seem to care just brought the manger over. All he did was comp half of our meal. But that didn't make up for the fact that 3 out of 4 people in our group who all had different meals and didn't share food, were nauseous for the next 24 hours and sick. Food positioning no doubt. This was the last straw with red robin. Never eating at this chain again. Will post pictures of our food if I can...

This situation just keeps getting worse.  We had horrible service when we were ate here the last time.  Now we got our credit card bill to find they added on extra charges to the Bill!   We did tip but it reflected on the poor service we received.   Now to have someone add on charges without consent.  And no we didn't have a big party.  So this is just plain 'ole fraud.

We went at 8 pm on a Friday night, were seated in 15 minutes then waited 40 more to get our food. They brought all but one kid's meal then we waited almost 10 minutes for the final kid's meal. The kids were so tired that they ate less than 1/2. It was not busy either. The waitress offered us free dessert but we said no and were clearly anxious to leave. What she should have offered was to comp the grilled cheese that was delayed the extra 10 minutes. As usual the food was not hot. This location needs to work on coordinating kitchen and waiters.

I went there on Veteran's day. Red Robin and restaurants were kind enough to offer free food to Veterans on that day, It was a zoo in there when I came about 5 pm. I went to the bar since it was a long wait for the main dining room. I ended up sitting near two older veterans and we all had a good time. Even though it was crazy and hectic, the majority of the Red Robin staff kept their head about themselves and displayed a positive attitude. Very commendable and professional. Nicole in the bar was friendly to everyone and made sure we were all taken care of well. She understood customer service very well. I think Red Robin should promote her to manager if she isn't already. This kind of person is great in any customer service environment.

Went for a free burger last Tuesday.. " Sea Hawks Tuesday." burger was nothing to write home about but it was free!. Their fried onion rings were delicious, the best that I have had in a long time.  My companion had the Blue Cheese burger and salad for $15.00 which is a bit much, cause it wasn't that great. Service was very good and attentive.  I usually sit in the bar area, cause it can get really loud in the main dining room, especially if there are lots of kids.

This is a really busy location, I have been here four times and every single time there has been a wait no matter what time you arrive. The burgers are not as good as some of their other locations that I have tried especially in the Midwest. Sometimes the food is cold by the time they bring it out. They also don't make the burgers as juicy as I've had in the past and I've not yet seen a blackened Cajun chicken burger here. Some other reviewers commented on the worn dishes and sticky floors and I find that to be true. It looks bright and cheerful but is getting run down. Since they are so busy there seems to be always wait for the food. I also do not like how they bring you just 8-10 "bottomless" fries and tell you to order more. If you order again they take a lot of time to bring it out and you've finished your burger by then. 3 stars. Not my favorite place for burgers.

The worst service EVER! Second time and no more... I have never not left a tip so this is a first. Yes it was that bad... Even when I asked to see a manager it took 20 min for her to acknowledge a upset customer. Do yourself a favor and go somewhere else.  Food is awful too! Corp needs to address this store and management team
WORST SERVICE AND WORST FOOD EVER.  That was fully disgusting and we will NEVER come back to this location.  I feel sick...

I love RR.  You know what your getting each and every time.  The consistency is always nice.  I'm on a new kick with their Bacon Cheese Burger.  Although I do wish they had better bacon, its rather thin and not very flavorable.

4/25/15 I've had great Red Robin dining experiences at this location and even yelped about one of them.  But we ate here yesterday afternoon and it was not good.  First they tell our party of 7 that it will be a 25 minute wait, which was odd because they were not even half full.  Then when we get to the table there are not enough seats and food all over the floor under the table.  The food took an unusually long time to arrive. I ordered the grilled chicken salad and the chicken did not look appetizing at all -- I actually didn't even try it.  And my final complaint is we had to ask several times for refills for drinks and fries.  Hoping it was just an off night, perhaps they were understaffed.
Why are the reviews so low. Overall they put out pretty good food and have a very decent amount of staff. Not top quality cuisine but one of the better places to go for good soups, salad, burgers.

I have been visiting in Issaquah since Dec  2014.  I have been to Red Robins in Denver, Co and Lower Michigan. They have all been very good and I was looking forward to a great Red Robin burger in Issaquah, Wa.  It did not happen to say the least.  The Bottomless fries arrived at our table cold so I did not even try them to see if the were what I had had before.  And as for the burger, it was barely warm.  I was shocked to say the least when the manager said, "I'll go ahead and remove your burgers from your bill." There is no way I would have claimed that burger and I was at least pleased that the manager of Red Robin said it was not her burger either. Since it had been 4 years since my last Red Robin burger, I think it will be easy to go for another few years before I try another.

I don't know what it is about this place... But I've been here several times now and each and every time the service is horrible & slow. I recently was just here and The same old story. 1) Took forever for the waiter to come 2) food took forever 3) my drink was never refilled - went the whole meal without a drink. We had to ask several times for things. Including asking the waiter twice for our bill. Our plates were not cleared after we ate. All in all we were there for about two hours... I swear this place is cursed

They used to be so good! But we have gone there twice in the past couple months, trying to give them another shot.... Both times, our food was cold. Like they had let it sit out for a long time... And when they brought us the food again, it was just a few degrees warmer. Very disappointed:(

Overpriced burgers and cold home fries.  All served by a staff that hangs out in the kitchen instead of checking on if their customers need a refill on their drink. Been here twice in the past few months and both times I have been disappointed.  The last time we sat at the table next to the kitchen where they expedite the food.  There were 7 employees, yes 7 of them hanging out, goofing off, Tweeting, texting, and at one point pinching each other.  Yep.  pinching!    Our table had three empty drinks.  I had to knock on the glass window to get someone's attention.  Food came out barely warm at all.  I finally asked for manager.    Her excuse for the overstaffing was they were in the middle of a shift change and had too many people "on the clock"  Isn't that one of her responsibilities as a damn manager?!  She was apologetic for our experience and offered to comp our meal.   I took her token offer and also informed her I would never return!!  and never will.

Red Robin is Red Robin wherever you go. Loud atmosphere, crappy service sometimes, good service sometimes, but never great service. This location in specific is generally busy but never wait more than 10 to 15 minutes. Great choice for non fast food but not expensive food in Issaquah.  Lettuce bun options instead are pretty good on most chicken sandwiches if you're trying to attempt to be healthy. My favorite is Tavern Double. Cheapest menu item and very fulfilling.  Appetizers - best mozzarella sticks (way better than Applebee's) and if you ask for a half order it's only a couple bucks and comes with 5. The boneless chicken wings sauce in side is good too. Desserts are ok. Tip: when someone orders appetizers make sure to bring them out and give ample time to eat before bringing entrees out 2 minutes later.  *make sure to sign up for their royalty program. They actually send out good coupon emails and every tenth item you get an entree free. Don't need a physical card just your phone number - why not.

This is by far the best burger in the area. My boyfriend and I always get a side salad with one and fries with another to share. Sometimes when we get it to go they put extra fries and dipping sauce on the side which is nice. Can't go wrong with the shrimp and chips or fish and chips too!

I am so sick of this place. Do not come here. I get takeout orders: -No-one around the bar to help pay for the order, -Had to put our own utensils in the bag (by itself, just confusing, why don't they do it, what if we forget?) -Ask for extra dressing (can't tell if we ever get extra)... -Today we ask for extra, and one of our salads didn't come with ANY... Customer service is lacking. Not outwardly rude, just not courteous. Do yourself a favor and get takeout somewhere else, Issaquah has lots of kid friendly restaurants, Issaquah has many restaurants of better quality management and service... UPDATE- I FOUND A HAIR IN MY FRENCH ONION SOUP THAT CLEARLY WAS NOT MY, OR MY MOTHER'S HAIR. JUST THE ICING ON THE CAKE...
Food came out late and cold. Why five stars? The manager came to our table, apologized, gave us free burgers and fries to go as well. 5 star service for being genuine and rectifying the situation.

Sad to say, I'm giving up on this location and possibly the entire chain. Having spent plenty of time in the restaurant business, I know that crispy fries with no salt aren't difficult. A little extra time, and DON'T PUT THE SALT ON THEM. Red Robin's method is a little different, take the fries that have been sitting there for ten minutes, covered in salt and throw them BACK into the fryer so the salt burns into them, and the outsides are burnt to hell, and the insides are a disgusting, congealed mess. Then, of course, never check back with the guest to make sure they haven't screwed up too badly. Spend all your time talking to your friends and the bartender. Much better solution. When you explain that the fries were inedible? "Oh, we can make you some more!", Mmm-hmmm, after I've eaten my entire sandwich and three of my own fingers due to starvation? And how will they make them? The exact way they SHOULD, that I specified to the server when I placed the order and that she SWORE she'd get right? Nah, I'm not gonna wait around for them to mess up again. Easier to find another burger place. Or just skip burgers for something healthier.

Current 2.5 stars is about right. It's just Red Robin.  Nothing special.  Overpriced restaurant burger with family friendly atmosphere. This one though is overly crowded so very long wait.  Service was nothing special.  Server rarely came around other than the obligatory checking in.   We had already been waiting for our food for 30 min.  If we hadn't asked, who knows how much longer we would have waited.  The server brought out our food, responding reflexively that it had only just come out.  Only that our burgers were cold.  So no, not true.  We sent our food back and they didn't argue.  I asked for the manager and he took care of the items off our bill which we appreciated. It's just Red Robin, nothing special.  Kids liked it but otherwise I felt it was a waste of an evening.

Remodeling so it's boring but functional  Service was poor on my visit. No silverware or napkins. Didn't pick up menus. Very late to follow up after food arrived. I mentioned it was my sons birthday and didn't even ask if we wanted dessert

The food is great as usual. The interior is spacious and well done. The service sucks. Delivered water after a long time. Did not deliver to all. The server said that he will get the silverware. But it was not provided. The food came late.  I had to ask for silverware after food arrived.

No hostess door to greet guests.  When she finally arrived and asked how many in our party, she then said "it'll be a few minutes."  Had to ask the waiter for refills, flagging him down, unaware of basic service.  Chicken was burnt/dry. Waiter forgot to-go box twice.  Given the wrong bill.  No redeeming factors to earn any tips.  Just horrible.
this place gets only 2 stars for service, they are slow.  food is ok what you would expect.
This is one of the best red robins I have been to. George is amazing and it's not loud and noisy either. It's truly a very nice experience.

I haven't been here in a long time, so I thought why not give it another shot. 1. We made reservations over a month ago for a party of 12 for a birthday. We called the week before to confirm and they said all was good. When we arrived, they took us to our area which was 4 tables split up over an area. They apologized and told us they could have a table ready soon. 2. An hour goes by and we finally get a table. 3. We all order right away, then our food came out in waves of one dish here, one dish there, over the course of an hour and 20 minutes!!! The worst part was the server was nice and did an ok job, so I felt I had to tip. 4. So after 2 hours and twenty minutes we all finally have our food. Some had to be sent back because it was cold. 5. By the level of service, I wasn't expecting a lot. As we looked around, people we coming and going with there food right on time. It seems the larger party was already considered a loss so they didn't care.  They took off one meal for the bad service. I WILL NEVER COME HERE AGAIN. READ THE REVIEWS ON THIS PLACE ANYWHERE. The manager said they just fired there GM as an excuse. She also tried to say they were short staffed due to everyone going back to school. AS A MANAGER YOU PREPARE FOR THOSE THINGS. Did I mention we had several kids with us, as this was for a one year old's birthday?

Service was very poor. Waited more than 10 minutes for server. No introduction to ziosk, new computer device on table. Two members of our party refused to touch the device assuming that many germ invested hands must have contaminated it during the day. We miss the old Red Robin, which our family has frequented for the past 20+ years. BTW, you have to pay for the games on the ziosk.
I'm not angry... just disappointed that the bottomless fries I got were enough for half a person at a table for 3...

For all you gourmet burgeristas, this place is fun and upbeat, service is good and you can order as many fries as you can digest, in a week. The remodel is nice and I love the huge window views of the greenbelt behind the place. It's always crowded so get there early. Latter, take a lovely walk around the pond just behind the restaurant. After all a hamburger is just a ground up steak, so why spend all that money on sirloin? It's a busy place, but the manager needs some Red Bull, servers could be better trained. Servers and host/ess varies from fab to flakey.

Don't know why this has such low reviews, it's a ridiculously cheap burger place; of course it's gonna be overcrowded and they hire a bunch of high school kids (who don't know very much about customer service, they're children give em a break). I've been bringing all my dates here since high school myself and all through college, solid food, servers always hook it up with the bottomless fries and it's just a chill general atmosphere.

An entertainment fee tacked onto my bill !  For what?  No explanation for, it was just listed as a line item on the new electronic self-swipe check-out device.  If @redrobinburgers is going to charge me an entertainment fee so that they can pass on the cost of deploying self-payment devices then I'll find someplace else to eat.  On the way to the car my wife and I looked at each other and said "I guess we'll eat somewhere else next time."  Entertainment fees? At Red Robin?

Unfortunately my kids love this restaurant.  No idea why this place always entices children but my son decided to choose it for his 4th birthday.  With a table for 15 we were seated in a decent time with a 15 minute wait on Sunday, September 13 at 5:15pm.  First, the hostess dropped off the stack of 15 menus on the table.  She didn't even think of distributing it to each seat so I had to do the job for her.  Is it because she expected she'd get her 18% gratuity portion for a big group so she didn't have to do her job?  This was only the beginning of a bad night. After everyone sat down we all ordered our drinks and food right away.  I have 3 kids all 6 and under and they waited quite patiently considering the long wait.  The drinks didn't all come in at the same time.  Whoever ordered a milkshake, like my kids, had to wait 20 extra minutes while those who ordered the freckled lemonade got theirs in 10 minutes.  The food started coming about 40 minutes after ordering.  There were 5 people who were served first.  Waited another 5 minutes and another 5 people in my group were served.  Here's the catch, the last 5 people who weren't served were my husband, my kids and me!  In the past they have always made sure to serve kids first.  What child is going to sit still for an hour?  None of my kids were screaming or crying but they were getting restless.  We waited another 15 minutes and my kids dishes finally arrived.  But, where was my burger and my husband's burger?  At this time my brother in law was done with his meal and the grandparents at the other end of the table were nearly done.  My sister had gotten her Banzai burger only to find out her patty was completely charred and so was the inside of the bun.  She had to ask for another.  Same thing happened again for the 2nd burger and Alana, our waitress, said they didn't cut her burger in half for her, which she asked when she ordered, because it would be quicker to get it to her as she set her burger in front of her.  Uhh... who does and says that?  Lazy?  Once again, her burger did not have any pink in the inside.  What baffled all of us was how my sister was able to get a replacement burger the first time before my husband and I even got our order.  I finally got my Teriyaki Chicken Burger only to find my chicken and bun was also burnt.  Fed up and fuming after waiting 1.5 hours without our food, I asked for a manager. Amy, a floor manager, came because the manager in the kitchen couldn't come out since he was cooking that night.  My husband and I were livid.  We couldn't believe all that happened.  My sister's 3rd burger came shortly before my 2nd replacement came and my husband still didn't get his first order of his Royal Red Robin Burger.  We shared our dissatisfaction with the food and service to Amy again.  This time almost yelling because we were appalled.  Why hadn't Alana told the kitchen my husband's burger wasn't made and to skip the rest of the orders on the queue to make his!  Amy informed us Alana had been working at RR for awhile because the way she acted seemed like she was a newbie.  Alana decided to forget about us or thought a big group means automatic 18% gratuity so she never asked how our food was or refilled any of our drinks.  She never thought of bringing more napkins for us with kids at the table.  Our drinks were all refilled only after my husband and I had a talk to the manager.  Burnt food, no refills, long wait times and not serving my kids first were all that dampened the birthdays we were celebrating.  My husband only got his Royal Red Robin burger 2 hours after we ordered.  Never again Issaquah Red Robin... On the plus side our food was comped and we got a gift certificate but the service really needs to be looked into and we still can't believe it. Training to all staff needs to be done by either their general manager or corporate.  First, orders for any table should be together.  There should NEVER be a time when people get their food while others at the table are completely done with theirs.  It's just rude!  Second, a table shouldn't be left to no service just because they think they will get their 18% gratuity.  No drink refills, no asking how the food was, or if we needed utensils, napkins, extra fries or sauce.  Why would a hostess not distribute all of the menus to each seat or to each person?  I will never understand unless it's McDonald's and I'm ordering from the counter.   On a side note for parents... do not ever ever order milk from this location.  It is not properly cooled.

Still love Mike- he's the best, everyone else sucks. They charge you $1.99 to play trivia?! This is stupid - I'll go to BWW and play FREE trivia.  Also the new tavern double deal SUCKS. We really enjoyed two drinks and an entree and get the burger free...now we have to buy an appetizer? Way to be cheap red robin. Shit service, "bottomless" French fries that we are always told we probably won't be able to get (yep, there's one girl who says that EVERY TIME, "I'll see if I can get you some!" Are you kidding?!), charging for trivia and now changing the deal. My husband and I go to RR at least once a week, not anymore! We will give our money to BWW.
It's less than 1 star for service, service there really sucks!! Even managers sucks and leave you without responding to ur request.. This is my last time to enter this place!

If I could give 0 stars I would.  This place used to be decent, but the past couple times it's gotten worse and worse.   Took my daughter for dinner, I ordered a burger and she got kids meal corn dogs - not exactly specialty items.  Waited about 30 minutes, never got our food.  Asked server, she says "it's being plated, will be right out".  20 minutes later I ask "where's the food?" And she says "I'm sorry, my manager will be out to speak with you" Another 20 minutes goes by, no manager or any sort of explanation whatsoever.  So we just left.   On way out, I tracked down the manager and told him they're not running a very good operation, and he tells me "sorry, I don't have time for this" and walks away!! I'm a local, and used to enjoy coming here.  But pretty sure that was my last attempt, it's just gone too far down hill.  Get a new manager in there who knows what he's doing!

Service: 2 stars our server didn't greet us, we had to use the new iPad like devices at our table for him to ever come to our table. We told him we were in a hurry, and we waited 45+ minutes for 2 house salads.  Food: 2  we used to love coming to Red Robin. The prices have gone up and the portions have gone down. And like I said, waited nearly and your for sub par food.  Atmosphere: 3 though they have remodeled and made it more modern, it's not the Red Robin we grew to love. Does not feel family friendly at all. Also the paper napkins used to wrap the silverware and keep it somewhat clean. Now they just toss the silverware ontop of napkins after multi employees have touched them.  Customer service: 1 the hosts were not friendly by any means, and we're not efficiently or effectively doing their job. Coming from someone who works in the restaurant business, I know how to greet and respectfully and professionally interact with customers and guests. Overall: 2 disappointing for sure to see such a great franchise so poorly managed and operated. Will not be returning to this location.
Absolute worst red robin for service and quality of food we have ever been too. Ruined our evening and family dinner.

Negative stars! We had the worst experience ever here. It took 45 minutes to get our food, mine was luke warm, but at least edible. All of my boyfriends food was cold, the egg was not cooked and was cold and slimy. We talked to the staff, and the manager said he would take care of it, which was fine. We had thought they would be making our food again, or at least my boyfriends since it was inedible and was sent back. HOWEVER, we waited another 15 minutes before a server asked if I wanted a box for mine and we told her we were waiting for his food again which she went to check on. The manager came over once more and said he thought we told him "we were good" so they had not re-made the food. We never said we didn't want his re-made. WHY WOULD WE BE GOOD? We came to eat, now all the sudden he wasn't hungry? Absolutely terrible experience, bad service and poor communication. So bad. Just bad. No more words, bad. NEGATIVE 5 STARS, SIRS!

So, so, so bad!!!  We went tonight (Sunday) at 5pm and got seated in a practically empty restaurant. We ordered promptly.  Our food finally arrived at 6:15 after we had been waiting (with 3 kids) for over an hour!!!  We had a fabulous server, Dwana (I highly recommend avoiding the place at all costs, but if you do go, ask for her, she really went above and beyond to do what she could).  When our food finally came, it was sub par - cold fries, clumpy mac n cheese that my daughter wouldn't eat, and my son's pizza came with pepperoni when he'd ordered just cheese. Our server took the pizza back right away to have it remade, but it took another 25 minutes to get it!  By the time the manager delivered it with no apologies, everyone else was done, so we just asked for boxes that never came.  We were there to celebrate my son's birthday, so our server did bring the birthday sundae, which was a disappointment compared to what they used to be - just a small square dish with a scoop of vanilla, a drizzle of chocolate sauce and whipped cream.  No sprinkles. No cherry. No candle.  I guess this is another change to the "new," less family-friendly Red Robin.   We asked to speak to the manager since he never came back, and when he came over, he was not at all apologetic and fairly defensive.  We were expecting a discount on our bill or coupons for next time, but instead, he acted like we should be thanking him for taking my son's pizza off the bill (but it was his birthday, so it was already free!!!).  He said he's only been working there for 2 weeks and they're understaffed.  (Then why are they seating so many people and not letting anyone know in advance it's going to be a longer wait than usual???)  He then proceeded to complain that he'd already been there for 12 hours and his wife is calling to yell at him because she's home with their 2 year old.   While I have sympathy for his situation, it is not my problem - I am there as a customer, and he is getting paid to do a job.  He still did nothing to "make it right", so we left completely frustrated and still a bit hungry.  My previously Red Robin loving kids said they never want to go back.  We will be going to The Ram from now on instead.

This place seems to be consistently understaffed.   10 minutes just to get our waters;  another 15 min. for our drinks to arrive and then forever for the food.  The food was ok.  The greens in my salad were only moderately fresh and the fries were cold.    I have been going to Red Robins for 20 + years and have seen the service and quality steadily go down,  but this was the worst!

Before I get to the food, the decor is adorable! It really gives the restaurant a unique flair. I went there after a business meeting near by for lunch and the restaurant was fairly busy. The server was attentive and gave us time to look through the menu. We ordered the onion ring tower (really delicious) as an appetizer and I got the Banzai Burger with fries. I must say the burger was pretty good. I liked that they grilled the pineapple slices, and the patty was not dry. The fries were not crispy, I didn't really care for them too much. We had a little hiccup with the self serve payment system (it froze on us) but other than that it was a nice meal!

Revised update 11/19: This place is a shitshow once again. The people at the front hostess are clowns trying to push you into the bar.  The kitchen was backed up for an hour between appetizers and entrees. Poor waitress apologized profusely even though it wasn't her far.  The manager was supposedly coming over to apologize which never happened. The server Dawan herself was great. The rest sucks. Sad place. Worth the 2.5stars they have at most.  ------------------------ What a change this Red Robin has come into. Not only did they redo the interior but they also redid the staff. It's 100% better. Everyone is attentive, not walking around like a bunch of clowns, and they act like real servers... Finally.  You typically wouldn't or shouldn't expect anything spectacular from red robin but this visit was something else. We had a server named Dre. He should be a server at Canlis. He was personable but not annoying, got everything we ordered exactly, and he made sure we had a pleasant experience. Not what you would've found from this place 6-9 months ago.  High regards to the new managers or new staffing director. Didn't recognize one server/expediter/busser/hostess, and that's probably a good thing.

We decided to give them another try. What a difference!  Our server, Melissa, was wonderful. We got our beverages and silverware very quickly. All of our food was prepared well. We will definitely be going back! Whatever changes were made, they're on the right track!

Not the same experience , not the same quality of employees since the remodel . The food was the same -delicious, speedy , as expected . But unfortunately the friendliness , attentiveness , and efficiency has changed . Too bad--I would assume there was a ton of thought and revenue dedicated to the remodel and the training of employees on the quality of experience.  Tonight's visit did not want to make us return to this particular property. Certainly hoping other  locations are more consistent with the old Red Robin experience .

This Red Robin is going downhill....fast. Management seems inexperienced, waits are ridiculously long (had to wait an hour!) And kitchen seems unorganized and inaccurate with how backed up they were. Our waiter Emily didn't seem happy to have us on this busy night and reeked of cigarettes. I talked to both managers Dan and Dax and they said that it's Red Robin standard to be this busy and that we should consider another place to dine in for a reasonable time wait and we were only a party of 4!. Extremely disappointing. Managers are jerks and I feel like this establishment in particular has potential but unfortunately lacks the proper employees to make that dream happen....

My family and I (two adults, two teenagers) just returned from a Sunday mid afternoon lunch at Red Robin Issaquah.  Over the past decade, we have gone  to Red Robin for a Sunday afternoon lunch at least once a month.  The service and food has noticeably gone downhill since Red Robin sacked the last manager earlier this year, supposedly because she was not making enough of a profit for the chain.  Today, we reached a new low.  We had a lousy server, who had to constantly be reminded to check on our food and the extra fries we ordered.  The place was not very busy at 2:15 when we were there, but we had to wait a good 40 minutes for our food.  When it arrived, it was cold (cheese on the burgers had already congealed).  To make matter worse, the two salads that we ordered as sides were made with old, brown lettuce.  Rather disgusting.  It will be a while before we return, which is very sad since our kids have grown up with Red Robin being a treat.  Not anymore!

We have lived RR for their fries and burgers but today was terrible. The food was disappointing, I expected more than a half a teaspoon of guacamole on a Guacamole burger, the presentation was put together obviously quickly. Worst part was the 20 minutes it took to try to check out on the remote iPad like system. Which never did work and charged us the bill 4 times.
Don't get the avocobbo. My stomach has been churning for 48 hours. Let's just say...it ain't pretty.

Bottom less is great, off course, but the time they serve our orders are way too long than average.  Eventually we asked what's going on, and our server found out other server took our order!!! What a mess! They NEED to improve kitchen organization and their serving speed. They have entertainment system in each table and kids love to play those, but you will be charged $1.99 at the end.  Our server was very well manner,  but overall the service was just 1 star.

We love Red Robin, and these guys generally do a great job. We have been frequenting this location a couple times a month since summer 2015, and usually alternate between takeout and dining in (with a toddler).  We've only had one *bad* experience dining in. Unfortunately it was on my son's birthday. The server we had was not attentive at all (despite it being a not-so-busy Wednesday night), took almost half an hour to help clear up our check (trying to use a coupon) AND didn't tell the staff it was my son's birthday (the main reason we'd gone out to eat in the first place - so he didn't get sung to). As we were leaving, I stopped to use the restroom, and she was in there Facebooking on her phone.  That experience aside, we've really enjoyed the food, service has overall been good, if not great, and takeout is usually good as well (occasionally get a mess up, but nothing worth crying over). They also do a great job accommodating a gluten free diet.  We will continue visiting so long as we live nearby.

RR is one of my favorite chain restaurants.  Love the remodel at this location.  PLEASE add Free Wi-Fi for your customers.   Note to Corporate Red Robin - Please change the French Onion Soup recipe back to the way it was.  New recipe is no bueno!
Everything you need, good food, good drinks. You know what you're getting and it makes choosing a spot for dinner easy.

Rarely come here due to unhealthy food, food usually comes as expected, 1star for clean place.  One time me and my wife were ordering cocktails and the server demanded id's. I had mine on me but my wife left her purse in the car. So i told sever just bring one because i did not want to go back to the car. So he served us with a drink and as soon as he walked off he was watching us to make sure my wife did not drink. It was so funny how he litterally was watching. So i said to my wife he is really watching you so do not sip on my drink, let me get your id first. I came back with her id and said go ahead have my drink. And guess what as soon as she did he ran up and said you can not drink unless she has her id to verify that she is old enough. He thought she was under 21. She handed him id and the look on his face made us laugh!!!! Cheeseee
This place has gone way down hill. The food was down right gross. Bagged withered salad and cold frozen chicken. Yum!!

We stopped in around 3PM and there were more employees than customers in the building. We sat at the bar, and were ignored for almost ten minutes, even though we made eye contact with three multiple times. The food came quickly, but they were not attentive with our drink refills. We even had to wait a while to pay! I am not sure why there was such a delay, but this is disappointing!

This Red Robin is going down hill. The quality of the service has been consistently poor over my last several visits. It's not like they're slammed, it just seems like the servers don't really care any more. In my opinion, it started when they introduced the on table device for entertainment and your bill processing. The food quality is what you expect from a Red Robin and they do have inventive and flavorful burgers. And when you can get them refilled, the bottomless fries are awesome. I especially like that the Sweet Potato fries are bottomless, too.

Oh @RedRobin !!  Where did it all go so wrong?? We used to love Red Robin as a casual, family friendly place to take the kids.  Bottomless fries and rootbeer floats helped.  However the service has gone waaaay down hill the last few times we've been in.  Wait staff with attitudes and pretending to forget requests or downright ignoring them.  Waiting 30-40 minutes for burgers on a slow night with only 2 other tables filled.  Having to ask repeatedly for refills of drinks and fries...only for the waitress to come back and ask if there was anything else we needed and request fries again...rinse lather repeat. We finally gave up.  Seriously this last experience was terrible.  I asked repeatedly for a menu since what I ordered was not what I remembered...and was ignored.   Yep and they want you to order and pay bill with kiosks....and in the meantime get cold food. And they don't tell you until you get the bills, that there is a charge to use the kiosk trivia game while you wait for those cold fries and lackadaisical service. Always lovely to have the waitress stand behind me to watch me sign bill and allot tip and try to fill out survey of bad service on kiosk. Bad waistaff faux pas 101.  Walk away when bill is being signed.  Watch me?  It gets smaller.  This last time was three strikes, you're out. I told my husband to remind me that we never want to go again. I mean we should have noticed the downhill trend when the big excitement was to get a helium balloon when we left when our kids were little, and now there are sad pre-filled air balloons on sticks.  Can't even be bothered with that.   And that kitschy, pop culture decor that always set Red Robin apart as part of their brand?It seems to be getting replaced with tacky Applebee's style bland decor with smoked glass and inpersonal kiosks at tables. Sigh what a shame! Luckily, there;s The Ram just down the road. Better food, better beer, and better service.  Keep your dang balloon!

Just finished with the worst experience we've had at this restaurant. Waited to be seated for 45 minutes even with a reservation, the food was mediocre, but the worst part of it was the woman changing her baby's diaper on the table next to us. The busboy cleaned the table with the same rag he used for other tables. When we pointed out to the manager that this was a breeding ground  for E. coli we were given a no big deal attitude. We won't be back.

Mixed feelings about this place...  We waited 30 minutes to get seated, then another 45 minutes to get our food after ordering.   Pros: - Great for kids - Modern remodel, nice atmosphere, pay at the table  - Extensive menu, something for everyone - Servers try really hard to give great service Cons: - Waiting to be seated - After being seated, waiting to get food.  Waiting over 45 minutes for some burgers is not acceptable.  - Waiting to get more fries.  Not sure why this takes so long either.

After a hike during a sunny day, stopping by Red Robin seem like a good idea for burgers and such. Once you're here, the inside is surprisingly huge in comparison to the other Red Robin places I've been to. With the option to eat outside, the large bar area or the general dining area, there are definitely plenty of seats. With that in mind, my group of 6 didn't wait any longer than 5ish minutes to get seated. Overall, dining experience itself was alright. Service was a bit slow but our waitress tried her best to be lively and personable. For the bottomless fries......it was a little tough in getting refills with this since all of our refills were miniscule amounts and with our waitress constantly being away, we didn't enjoy as much fries as we had wanted. However, our waitress did make a great attempt at letting my group sample the various sauces to which we all appreciated. Major upside to this place was: the little check machine works! And it works beautifully when you're trying to split checks in a group. Fairly intuitive, this machine is easy to use when splitting the bill, playing games (it cost $$$), or ordering more food. If you choose to split the bill, make sure everyone has a card! Otherwise, have your server do the bill splitting if it involves checks and such.  Overall, typical Red Robin visit for yummy burgers and fries.

The main problem with this location is it is VERY SLOW.   Have been here for lunch during the week, and a late lunch on weekend a few times. Servers are nice, but always seem to be too few for number of tables.

This is not an in-restaurant dining experience. I tried calling to place an order for pick up on my lunch break. I called twice, both times it rang for 3-4 minutes with no answer. Ended up getting lunch from somewhere else.
Again, another bad experience at Red Robin. Maybe it's time to give it up and realize all the employees at different locations just hate their lives. Red Robin, this is bad.

I'm not a fan of Red Robin burgers, but will order a salad from time to time when the whole office gets a to-go order.  Every time I've gone to pick up the order the place is packed; but fortunately, there is a parking space designated for to-go orders and you can just walk up right to the bar and cash out on one of their machines yourself.  Usually the to-go order for about 10 people is ready in 20 minutes.  Service is always friendly, and calling in ahead of time makes it easy.  I have ordered the Crispy Chicken Tender Salad, and it's fine.  It's not bad, but I wouldn't say it's anything worth mentioning.  The lettuce is usually a mix of iceberg and romaine and is often on the more wilted/aged side.  Portion of chicken is decent.  My colleagues have ordered burgers, and have asked for extra fries which RR always provides with however many dipping sauces you want.  I just don't think the food is up to par with its speedy and friendly service.

I went to Red Robins with my friends to each luch, but the experience went horribly. It all started with the waiter. He was very snobbish, always trying to avoid a bad situation. Lets go to the ordering section. I ordered a burger, but the wait time was 2 hours! The people around me all got their food before me, some even got their food after coming a hour after I did. Dont ever come here, unless you want hell.
This is incredible!  An hour and a half into this and my son STILL hasn't received his entree.  Our food and drink orders have been delayed and messed up.  What a terrible experience!

Came in on a Tuesday just after the lunch rush had settled for a bit to eat. We stood in the lobby for ten minutes, employees passing us the whole time, waiting for a host to take us to a table. I couldn't believe it. Once we finally did get a table, the food came quickly and it was great.  I got a chicken avocado Cobb salad and some sweet potato fries. The chicken was smokey and moose and the dressing complimented it really well. The waitresses were bright and cheerful.

We walked in and there was almost nobody there. We got seated and ordered. The server Mac was nice, however the food took about an hour to get there. Also when the food got there it was very cold and tasted pretty bad honestly. And they forgot the sauces. Our drinks never got refilled either.
