As we were walking out there were still barely any people seated; yet a huge crowd waiting in the lobby? Doesn't make sense to me. Also throughout the meal we heard bickering between the waiters. There are much better places to drop your cash on food.

I would give zero stars if I could. This place used to be a great family gathering place. However, since a few months ago, it is absolute crap. Waiters are totally out of it. Food comes out extremely slowly. Don't expect to dine here in less than 2 hours. People who came in a half an hour later than us got their food WAY before us. Will never return and encourage anyone who reads this to do the same, and never come here. This place is absolutely ridiculous.

Slow, slow, slow!!! Everything is slow in this place! Don't know what happened to this place? Ever since the remodel last year, service has really suffered! There's so much staff working here, don't know why that can't get it together! The food takes for ever to arrive.  If it does come, it never comes together so some people have to wait while people with food are pressured to not eat and wait too while the food gets cold. I think the waiters rely too much on the tablets on the tables thinking they don't have to service the guests anymore.   Only saving grace for this Red Robin is the quality of food and bottomless fries. Food taste good but not great! The double tavern burger is a great value! What stuck out in my head in this place was a waiter napping on the table behind the host stand in front. I guess they really work the workers hard in this Red Robin. Won't come back to this Red Robin!!!

I'm writing this review at 35 minutes wait for food. Table next to us had an hour and 20 minute wait. No food is worth waiting this long. By the time it finally comes, we are too over-hungry and annoyed to enjoy it. I'm sad because Red Robin is one of the few places I can get a gluten-free burger. But we aren't coming back. We have a 30-45 minute wait every time.  Finished this review; still no food in sight... Update: We gave up and left. I'm so hungry I have a headache and I'm very sad. We recently moved to Issaquah from Seattle. We went to the Red Robin near us in Seattle so often they knew us by name. RR is one of the few places I can get a gluten-free burger. I love the food. I miss the food. I miss the fun of going to RR. I miss all the fun times we used to have at RR. This is the 5th time in a row when we've had to wait more than 40 min for food on a non-weekend, post-dinner-rush evening. We are never coming back. #goodbyeforeverredrobin

So my wife and I frequent this particular location quite often. We have reserved ourselves to the expectation of poor service at this location. Interestingly enough, it seems to be isolated to this location. When we are away or just simply trying a new one the service is on point. We noticed this location has gone through several management changes over the last 12 months or so. Nothing has changed. This trip was a fairly common occurrence when we eat here. Adult meals showed up 10-15 mins before the kids meals. Ordered two apps that never showed and we ended up getting them to go. Don't know what even happened there. Our server was extremely slow and highly incompetent. Just saying. Took 3 trips back to the computer to get the bill right. Actually charged us for 4 apps not 2, yes the same apps that never showed. I just in good conscience can't give this place more than 1 star. Hope management reads this. Changes are absolutely needed here.

This was our first time at this location and it will be our last. We walked in and we were the only ones waiting. After five minutes without a host/hostess in sight, we sat at the bar. After another ten minutes, our server finally arrived with menus. It didn't get much better after that, while our server was nice enough, service continued to be slow. If it had been a busy night I might understand, but the restaurant was not busy at all. Won't be back.

Two stars only because the food is good. Not sure what happened to this place, but it seems after the Ziosks they have, service has been terrible, always slow. Even when you order drinks or food through the tablet, service is still slow and a lot of the times the tablet encounters an "error".

We ordered a meal for carry out. Close to the hour mark, and being ignored repeatedly by the bartender, my wife asked the manager for a refund.  He said that while a refund was not possible, a gift card was offered and then checked one last time for the food. Apparently it had been sitting under a lamp for god knows how long and upon delivering the food, took back the gift card stating the he had solved the problem. Impossibly tacky and the worst service in recent memory. By the way... The order was wrong.
Food is tasty and definitely kid friendly. Love getting milkshakes there with the family. Just wish they had a bigger selection of main courses other than burgers.
One star is one too many. We have been sitting here waiting for our food for over one hour. 35 minutes ago we were told our order was on its way. Do not set a foot in this restaurant. Ever!!
Waited over a hour just for appetizers.  Since January 2016, the service has gone from sub standard to horrid. After several years as a customer,  I will never eat here again.

Usually this Red Robin has great service times, but something went wrong.... Last night (Aug 5th 2016) we chose to visit Red Robin for my birthday. We sat outside. We knew it would be busy, as Friday nights typically are, however there were some serious staffing issues in the kitchen. Our party had to wait over an hour for appetizers, and over an hour for food. I think we might have waited an hour and a half -- maybe more.. Eventually we cancelled the appetizers, and asked for a manager. The manager was very attentative. He came right out to our table right away. Just as he had arrived, the appetizers we had waited so long for, and canceled, magically arrived too. The manager heard my party stating that we had canceled the appetizers, and he comped them out for us as a courtesy. He then proceeded to de-escalate a gentleman in our party who was extremely disturbed by the service times, as he has health issues that put him in a position to where he needs to eat within a certain amount of time or he gets sick . The manager was very accommodating, and patient! We also pointed out the fact that the table next to us had been waiting longer than we had and they had a young child with them. After hearing that, he made sure to visit their table immediately after visiting ours. I was impressed by the manager's willingness to take accountability for matters that were apparently out of his control (the kitchen was short staffed, due to staff calling in sick, and also the kitchen is using a new computer system or something like that...). I was impressed with our waitress too, as she had a heart of gold ... She was very professional. She was genuinely bothered by the timing issues of us getting our food, however she never bad mouthed her boss or coworkers. She apologized to us, and brought us complimentary french fries to hold us over while waiting. She was very patient as well when dealing with getting strong negative feedback from one of the disgruntled members of our party. She remained professional and empathetic to his situation, as we had been waiting a long time for our food. It made me feel good that she cared about us as customers. ALSO she accommodated my medical condition (recent weightloss surgery) by switching the complimentary "birthday icecream sunday" for a small bowl of fruit instead. THAT meant ALOTTT to me as I cannot eat processed sugar or I will be sick for hours. In the end, the manager ended up comping alottt of our bill. I felt that he comped a fair amount and we paid a fair amount. The manager did the right thing. And thats why I wanted to do the right thing and be sure that both the manager and our waitress get recognized for their efforts to keep us as customers. I wish I took note of their names, but I did not. Im sure the waitress will remember me. All in all, I feel that the manager and the waitress helped me turn my 1 star review into a 4 star review. 4 stars for the customer service! Thank you!! --

Table #111 this afternoon... Manager needs to staff more servers to the bar area so the one server isn't running around with his head basically cut off. Got there right before 2:30...didn't get drinks (waters at that) until right around 2:50 even though several empty-handed servers from the lower portion of the restaurant were walking around. App came later but was cold. Main order didn't come until around 3:40. I'm surprised that our food was even remotely warm. Not hot by any means, but if the food was cold we were definitely walking out. Highly disappointed in the service! Also, your bartender needs to keep her voice down when she's criticizing other employees...heard every word she had to say and from the way she directed her comments she sounded like a real witch. If I could give 0 stars, I would.

If you have time to kill and enjoy cold food this is hands down the place for you.  Enjoy the staff coming by your table every 15 minutes explaining that your food will be right up.  Then 49 minutes after you walk in, food arrives, but it's not what you ordered.

So disappointed. Again. We used to come here a lot last year, because my parents absolutely ADORE the Artic Cod Fish and Chips Basket. They order it everytime! I get something new everytime, because their menu is so much fun. However, this year, we've been having a bad experience. In March, my mother and I came, and when you walk in and go straight (keeping the bar to the left), there's a set of seating to the right that's shares a wall with the kitchen. We got the table that has a small space in the wall so you can see the kitchen. My mom was watching, and there was a basket of fish and chips sitting there when we sat down. She kept watching, we ordered, we waited, and they gave her the exact same basket. It was cold and oily and overfried, so she asked for it to be redone. The waitress was kind about it, and they made a fresh one that she enjoyed. Whatever, we got over it. A few months ago, I stopped in with my parents, and my dad asked for a shot of vodka with a squeeze of lemon. Waiter brought him a glass of water with a slice of lemon in it. Okay. He corrected it... twenty minutes later. Food came late, but it was hot and we were tired, so we didn't say anything. We had a 15% off coupon, and that day, of all days, "all of their systems were down," according to alcohol-is-water waiter, so apparently we couldn't use it. Whatever, we got over it. Today, my mom and I had a long day, didn't feel up to cooking, so we went to Costco (literally thirty seconds away) to get gas, and then we went here to get dinner. We got our gas receipt from Costco at 4:35, and (for those of you who know how closeby it is) we were inside Red Robin by 4:40. We were seated by Andy, who was friendly; he gave us menus, and said our server would be there shortly. We were sitting and chatting, and there were three other occupied tables in our section. One of the servers was going back and forth to those three tables, and about twenty minutes later, after our failed attempts to flag down Andy, the server finally stopped by our table and asked, "Have you been helped yet?" We were confused and he explained that we weren't in his section and that no one told him that our table was assigned to him. We were a little peeved, but he [Jake?] was very apologetic so we brushed it off. We got water and ordered our meals. Around 5:20, we were getting a little impatient because we'd been sitting there for a while. I didn't know how long it had been, so I asked my mom to go get the gas receipt from the car to make sure I wasn't just being fussy about the wait. She left and came back with a receipt that showed that we'd been there for atleast 45 minutes. Jake was nowhere to be found, and the other three tables had ordered, gotten their food, and one had already left in the time we sat there. Another group even came, sat, ordered, and got their drinks by the time we looked at the receipt. We decided to leave, and my mom asked Jake to cancel the food. A waiter at the front asked us if everything was okay, and my mom explained that we'd been waiting for 50 minutes, 20 of which were without service. He found it absurd, given that there were less than twenty customers the entire time, and then the manager (who had been standing behind the waiter the entire time) simply offered us a gift card. ???? We didn't get service for twenty minutes and then we didn't get food for thirty minutes. Just because your employees can't communicate and your kitchen is slow doesn't mean you can get us to shut up with a gift card. We came for food that we intended to pay for. Money is not the issue. We don't need the gift card. We were already pissed off enough, but he didn't even bother explaining why they were slow, or even apologizing. Fix your service, train your staff. Don't throw gift cards at people that were disappointed by the mess that this place has turned into.

Went to the bar on a Wednesday night for dinner. Young lady who "served" us was flat out rude. She just didn't understand that she is there to represent The Red Robin brand to customers in a positive, welcoming manner.  The rest of the team were lovely, professional people. Unfortunately one bad apple ruined the entire experience for us. Too many choices in Issaquah to eat so we will go elsewhere with our hard-earned dollars.
Beyond noisy, bad food. Fries were warm at best and skimpy. Artichoke dip was a bright weird green with corn chip bits. Burger tasted only of relish and the bun was not fresh. Yuck.

I only gave one star because I couldn't review with no stars. We had a horrible experience.  We ordered drinks for four people and was charged for five drinks.  After waiting an eternity for the waitress to come to our table we went ahead and split the bill to start to pay.  When the waitress finally came to the table with the extra drink remaining on the bill she argued that we where wrong.  We ended up paying and leaving, we didn't have the time for her to figure it out at this point.  Well we thought we would give them another chance, and that was a mistake.  The waiter ordered our food and brought our drinks.  Someone else dropped off our food very quickly, and never refilled our drinks.  We clicked the table top computer for service, but to no avail.  We went the whole dinner without anything to drink.  No sign of a waiter.  We paid at the table top computer and left, with nothing.  We won't be going back ever.  Apparently they don't care about this, as these reviews show no improvement.

Hunter is the beat server! He makes great recommendations and is very attentive. I ordered the clucks and fries & he recommended a great dipping sauce that i had no clue about. I didn't even have to ask for a refill on my drink!:

This place leads me to post my very first Yelp review. If you have the chance to go, DON'T! I've never had a good experience here. While most Red Robin's are pretty average, this one has the worst service and food imaginable. Today it took almost an hour to seat us. While waiting I listened to 2 people complaining to management. We almost slipped on a spilled drink that still is sitting on the floor. When seated we were told just an app would be at least a 30 minute wait. Since we are trying to catch a movie in 40 minutes, we didn't even have time to eat. Had they seated us in the 10 minutes they said it would take instead of the half hour it might have been ok. Last time I was here we sat in the bar and the bartender was extremely rude and unattentive. They didn't have the correct liquor to make one of their signature drinks. The time before that I got severe food poisoning from a salad. Save yourself the trouble and time and go somewhere else. I will NEVER be back! #worstserviceever

So I love Red Robin. I love the food and drinks and think they are very reasonably priced. This Red Robin is terrible. The service is horrible, you wait forever for your food. Don't bother ordering appetizers because you won't get them until your food comes out. This last visit, we came on at 11am on a Sunday because I was craving a Whiskey BBQ wrap. We were seated, given menus, and told our server would be with us shortly. After about 8 minutes our servers comes over and we order our drinks, appetizer, and food (there were just TWO of us.) This was obviously a mistake as it seemed to be information overload. We ordered boneless wings with ranch, one beer, one water, BBQ wrap and a burger. Guy left and I got my beer a few minutes later. Had to ask again for the water. After about 15 minutes we were wondering where the appetizer was. The server said he would check on it and it came out about a minute later and our food followed.  My fries were ice cold. I've never had fries that cold, ever. The burger was the wrong burger. My boyfriend is just pissed and hungry and at this point but I tell him to have them make him a new burger. Not a big deal, mistakes happen. When the server came back we let him know it was the wrong thing and he said he must not have heard right, and really had an attitude about it. A few minutes later he comes back and asks if it's necessary to make a whole new burger or if he can just add the Mac and cheese to it (it was suppose to be the new Buzz Tavern Mac and Cheese burger but they just gave him the regular Tavern) My boyfriend lost it at this point and said forget it because obviously it was an inconvenience for him to get the correct food as the server was still giving him an attitude and side eyeing him as he walked away. The server tried to back pedal but at this point it was too late, we asked for the check and left. I was charged for the burger that we never touched.  I wanted to speak to the manager however no one was at the hostess station so I had no one to ask. Also there was a line of people waiting for the hostess and no one was there so people were leaving since they had been waiting for a while. Poor management and lack of communication and major attitudes make this a terrible place to go. Lots of other choices in the area. Safe yourself the disappointment and go elsewhere. We will not be back.
This place is horrible. Out of most beers and takes forever to get food. Very unpleasant

Red Robin is Red Robin. The food is always consistent here but the service is hit or miss. We've had some recent visits where the service was lacking and the food took forever to come out. Luckily, we've usually been with big groups so we've been able to entertain each other without us caring much, but it's definitely noticeable.  Some favorites here are the French onion soup and chicken Caesar wraps, the sweet potato fries, and the crispy chicken salad.  This place isn't fancy and there are usually a ton of kids screaming but it's good for a chill night out and it's close to home.

Vegan rating: 1.5 stars. They have vegan options but they are generic and meh Overall rating:  The food here is generic American food (burgers, fries, sandwiches, etc.), although they do have bottomless fries (or whatever side you get) with your burger, which is nice. I had a veggie burger with steamed broccoli on the side and it was edible but nothing to write home about. The servers were friendly and indifferent. This is a pretty generic establishment that I wouldn't seek out but would go to again if I had to. One interesting thing is they have tablets on the table that you can use to order and pay (and play games!), so you theoretically don't have to interact with anyone while you're here.
Red Robin is excellent! Our family goes here frequently (at least once a month). My favorite is the Red Royal burger and fries. Sometimes the service is inconsistent, but we keep coming back!

Red Robbin is pretty consistent location to location. I do have to say that the service at this location was better than most. The burgers are good but some of them are way over priced. $14 for a burger is kinda steep. I usually order the Royal Red Robbin Burger. Egg, bacon and cheese in a burger. How can you go wrong with that. Bottomless fries are always a plus. Good beers on draft.

This place meets my expectations every time. (1) no one will be at the host stand when I arrive and when they do show up, they will be confused on which tables are available.  (2) when they finally seat you, the restaurant will seem awkwardly warm, and you will wait for what feels like an eternity for someone to greet you.  When they do greet you, you should hurriedly order drinks, food, desert, all at one time.  Because if you don't, this will be a painfully long "quick lunch" (3) the servers while nice, optically look like they may have been released from prison or drug rehab.  (4) the food will be good.

I always love my visits here! even when they are understaffed they make sure you are taken care of, I went in here one night with what seemed like only 3 servers on and Alex was great she made sure we were taken care of even though she was clearly slammed she managed to get us everything we need and more! Great staff, great food!!

Love Red Robin, awesome franchise. I've been to this location twice now because I was in the area and each time I got food poisoning. Their chicken is EXTREMELY underdone. Can't speak for any of the other meats, but I went here about two days ago and got the Bruschetta Chicken and I still feel sick from the PINK meat. I had two bites of it and I was in too much of a hurry to comment on it. Super unhappy.

This place is some kind of joke!  1) we were in line but they give table to people who came in after us, we were standing with baby like ... WTF 2) it's took more then 20minute to get waiter's attention and take our order  3) brought  wrong order  4) just s*** service even tho restaurant was almost empty

Thought I'd give this place a second chance but I was wrong! We arrive on a Saturday night at 9 pm place looks dead. We wait to be seated guy comes and says how many? No greeting nothing. We sit, order and wait, wait for about 30 minutes. We don't see our waitress for 20 minutes. We ordered chili fries, boneless wings and kids meatballs. We ask what's going on. The waitress says well everybody's waiting for their food. Manager was talking to the table next to us because they were waiting for their check and decided to go up front to pay. Imagine that waiting. No one said hey sorry it's taking long here's some fries or anything. So we left. Never again are coming up. Giving them 1 star is too nice.

Food at Red Robin is really good. Burgers are tasty and fries are hot. However their service is absolutely terrible. It takes 20 minutes to get my water refilled and the waitresses have forgotten to enter our order twice in the past year. Lot of systemic problems could be fixed by better communication. Great food but get a pitcher of water because their service is D-.

This place is disgusting.  Bathroom doesn't have any hot warer, door handle going out of bathroom was crusty. Hot chicken dish was cold and side salad had brown lettuce...The advertised cheesy bread served with salad (which was hugely mediocre) was in reality just 2 croutons.  We will not be back.
Supposed juicy burger was as dry as can be! What happened to this place? Used to be if you ordered a burger it was messy to eat! Not any more, both of ours, different kinds, were really dry!

Great place to go to with family! Kids had a great time. This location is spacious and ambience, servers are attentive and courteous. They have activities kids going on. Food was good especially the onion fries were awesome.

Horrible service! No one checked us in...Three staff members were standing there and were too busy chatting. 20 minutes. Once I mentioned something, we were taken to a table. No apologies, then we waited 15 minutes at our table with no word from a single employee. Our waiter went by several times and said nothing to us. Nothing... like we were invisible. We left, told the manager, and he just stood there looking at the hostesses book. Went to the Ram in the highlands instead. Our 3 girls had great food and our service was great... burger, fries and 18oz beer for 10 bucks! Don't waste your time at Red Robin in Issaquah.

Here is an update to my bad experience with Red Robin Issaquah... I can see where Red Robin poor customer service comes from, it comes from the top. I received a lame email saying we will discuss with Issaquah restaurant then I received another email right after asking for a rating to how the problem was handled...very lame and dysfunctional operation. NEVER RED ROBIN AGAIN.

I was on a, Field Trip going to Red Robins there service. Is SLOW I waited 10 minutes for just 2 buns and one patty!       I also had carrots which was not washed they had white on them and they had black stuff on there. It was the worst place ever My last name starts with a,Y and they went by last name order and it was overwhelming looking at other kids eat there stuff as I just sitting in my seat just waiting and waiting so long so I was left as the last person getting there's but they went by table by table skipping mine and they are so slow they are giving kids refills and, my food is more important then STUPID REFILLS they should know better and I'm a kids I have Huge expectation for there service to be fine but there service is just a big Darn old BUTT this is truly a bitch place :) This is not a place to go to ok listen to me!

Wow... Seriously. Pass this place. Holy cow I'm not lying. Stopped in with a buddy (we're from out of town) asked for ideas received something real half ass from the bartender Andrew. He wouldn't let us order off the table top ordering deals. Seriously felt like he cared more about getting laid with the waitress employees than doing his job. My buddy was upset I recommended a good American burger over sushi and we were treated like trash. Thanks $60 wasted red robin. Terrible service.

If one could call Gorman Ramsay up to fix this place, I'd certainly be the caller. The fruit came out of cans and the lettuce tasted like bleach. The only thing that was partially decent was the chicken. Not only that, but this is the fifth time we've ordered an appetizer, and didn't receive it before the entrees. Typical. Never coming back again, and taking my money elsewhere. Too bad this used to be one of my favorite places.

Been here several times, always disappointed. Service is not great and the food is just not as good as expected. My husband this last time there got food poisoning from our outing; we will not be returning. I can drive to Redmond for better quality Red Robin.

Worst Red Robin ever!! First as I was being led to my table a young kid comes to the hostess and tells her she can't have our table. Doesn't even look at us.. just they have to wait to the hostess. So rude! So we wait another 10 minutes.. then we watch our waiter wiping his nose numerous times.. gross. Wiping it on his pants.. pick his teeth and thank god he didn't deliver our food. Gross! So as we are paying on the hand held device there's a spot to put in comments. I start typing in that the staff neeed some hygiene training and the gross Mgr starts leaning over my shoulder reading what I'm typing. He then grabs it out of my hand n acts like he's trying to check in on us. All the while deleting my comments!! I ask for it back and he claims it would have come to him anyway. I doubt that!! These are health code violations!! Snot in food is not ok!!! And he tried to cover it up! Let's say we had some serious words about his dishonesty where he claimed he didn't delete anything! Liar!!! So Mgr with the broken front teeth.. know that I contacted headquarters for Red Robin and the young kid can learn.. but you are as nasty as they come. Never going there again!!!
Meh, just like it says.  Needs updating and the food is ok.  Good family place.

Too bad I can't give them 0 stars. Seems like 1-star is being nice. Just finished eating there. My order came with "bottomless" fries. Well, not. The 6 or seven burnt shriveled fries that came with my burger looked like they were the left overs from last nights grease clean up.  The "waiter" (if that's what you want to call him) said he'd bring more fries. And fifteen minutes later, no fries. And nothing but excuses. You'd think a restaurant that offers bottomless fries would actually have fries? I mean, is that too much to ask.  At any rate, we've paid our bill and he comes back with yet another flimsy excuse. He says, "i'll get you those fries to go". Ten minutes go by, no waiter no fries. So, we pack up the kids and leave. As I am walking out I see numerous waiters for other tables walking out of the window area with fries.  So, bottom line, don't go here. Very poor service. Worst Red Robin I've ever been to. No I must go write a review on all the other review sites out there too.

I go here because my kids Force me to.  After tons of groveling whining and pleading we go.  It's less expensive than din tai fung, more tolerable than Chuck E. Cheese and you don't come out smelling like Benihana.  It's like a more relaxing five guys or fat burger..

I wrote a different review on RR for my experience with them as a delivery driver. This is purely review as a customer. I was craving a burger last night but considering my dietary restrictions (vegan/vegetarian) and being after 9pm, my only option was RR. I wanted to give them a try as hungry late night customer. Placed a to go order over the phone for a Garden Burger, no cheese, add grilled mushrooms + fries. When I got RR, which is located in a strange area for Issaquah, but ok, there was no host/hostess to greet me ... I had to walk around the corner to try to locate anybody, while customers were giving me looks because I looked lost.. I was ! A nice lady greeted me and left my bag on the table and told me to help myself with ketchup. (Laying next to brown, old limes... do they actually use these?? Yiek!) I was never given napkins or utensils. Then she showed me an iPad where I can pay, and it quickly prompted for a tip. I gave $2 since I wasn't that impressed to start with and my burger was $9. I selected 'email me' the receipt, so didn't scrutinize it until today. I just saw that I paid $17 for something that should cost 3$ at most. Here's why and I swear this is the truth and nothing but the truth! 1) Their fries, all 10 that I got, lol, yea that's puny considering 17$+ charge, were undercooked. I could taste raw 'potatoesness' ..ew, didn't finish. 2) Burger was filling, I'll give it that, but the bun turned soggy and was of weird green color, didn't taste moldy... so that's a relief. However, since I wasn't given napkins, the bun and food contents ended up everywhere. ( Had to eat in my car because I was waiting for someone ) 3) After 10 min of eating I started feeling sick as I tasted old grease in my mouth. Ew!!!! You know that overused grease that you shouldn't pour down your drain? That! I can now officially say that I hate RR with a passion, and would rather starve than give this establishment another penny! Just look at their reviews on Yelp! They suck and it's consistent throughout. I will compliment the girl working there, the receipt said Nicollette? She was the only one left on the floor to serve everyone, I guess RR can't hire..like 1 more person to help out greet customers, and check them out properly. Nicollette! Girl, you can do better than RR!

I used to order their Burnin' Love but recently discovered their Marco Polo and fell in love! It's BBQ style chicken and I get that with lettuce wrap and sweet potato fries. Absolutely delicious and it's what I order all the time when we stop by. Hopefully they will always have this on the menu.

Don't get outdoor seating. Great service for the first ten minutes, then no service for thirty. Food is decent as always, and the fries were perfectly crispy, but the service for this location as always struck me as "ehhhhh"

Poor service from start to finish. The server was inattentive and avoided our table like the plague. Messed up two orders, never checked on us, and Everytime we made eye contact he bolted in the opposite direction. When I finally got the manger involved his attitude got worse. He was extremely rude and never once apologized.  The only reason this is a 3 Star is because the food was good and the manger understanding. I would recommend not having jawaid as your server.

I don't know what happened to them being the best burger place, I have always gotten big restaurant style burgers there. The burgers we got Friday I could have gotten at Mc Donals for less than 1/2 the price. They were small, shredded lettuce not lettuce leafs, and the buns were obviously stale. We like the server who always waits on us in the bar so We didn't want to complain. We will never go back, and will let family and friends know how down hill the Issaquah Red Robin has gone. I don't know if they are cutting corners or what, but their burgers are a joke.
As we finish our time in Seattle today we had a great dinner at this red ribon. Our waitress was great and though busy was very attentive and seemed to work effortlessly.

All I can say is, Gabby is one amazingly harder working manager. Our server was pretty busy and Gabby seemed to just jump in and help. She grabbed us drink refills before we even asked and didn't seemed rushed. She was personable and full of personality. Never have I been to this location and had a manager even look our way. You can tell Gabby takes pride in her work. She deserves a raise!

I've been a long term patron of Red Robin, but after the way I was just treated will never give them my business again.  We went into the Issaquah location with 2 friends down from Canada. We sat in the bar and when the waitress asked for ID, she took one of the Canadian IDs and disappeared. When she finally returned, she asked for a passport and stated that the ID is not a valid form of ID. When we asked to speak to a manager, she was rude and asked us to vacate the bar while she attempted to get the manager to come talk to us.  When he finally came out and I questioned why he was refusing service and would not accept the ID, when on the Washington state liquor control board website it states that any Canadian ID is valid.  This is after the waitress said that we had to vacate the bar because it's an invalid ID and they would get a fine.  When the manager, Mike Mills, finally came out he was rude, and said it was a Red Robin policy but he wouldn't show us the policy.  Frankly, after the way we were treated, over a completely legal ID I will never do business there again.

One star because the food was standard Red Robin fare...beyond that, zero stars. Zero.  We frequent Red Robin quite often, not this location, but the folks who have visibility of our Rewards account know, we like us some Red Robin! But!!!... I've never eaten at a restaurant of any type, and had the experience linger in such a foul and disturbing way such as tonight. We were seated, just fine. Our server was initially, very deceptively pleasant...again, standard expectation for Red Robin. We are accustomed to friendly and attentive service. Apparently not in Issaquah. Maybe there's a different standard on the east side...maybe the training is a bit different...maybe in Issaquah they have lower standards, but I would find that remarkably difficult to believe. Our server became a ghost...well, not really, we could clearly see her congregating with the other Red Robin staff around their order station. Note to Red Robin in Issaquah, if you're going to allow your associates to stand around doing nothing, perhaps don't put the computer in the middle of the dining and seating area where your guests have crystal clear visibility of their wait staff talking....standing....doing literary nothing...not getting refills, not asking about our visit, not bringing the refills requested after finally nabbing her attention from the boys by the order station...Not correcting the fact that somewhere between you entering our order and the kitchen preparing our order there was a mistake made on our sons burger...not doing anything....hell, in Issaquah the servers don't even say goodbye! Or thank you! Or anything?!?  She literally avoided us, avoided eye contact, avoided conversation, avoided interaction, avoided all social, professional, reasonable accords of service and accommodation we would expect as a bare minimum considering you are an employee at a restaurant who's role is to provide friendly and engaging service!.... I digress, terrible visit. Terrible. And we have never given any other Red Robin less than exemplary feedback. Awful. It's as if we offended this girl with our very presence. Won't be back to this location. Ever.  And I hope this isn't a trend that spreads throughout the Red Robin brand.

Terrible.  I wouldn't be writing this review simply for the absolutely poor service we received.  Which was terrible from the start. We saw our bartender twice. The other people working were on their phones or hanging out by a table amongst themselves. The only hard worker I saw was the busier. No one gave us our check (the automated table service tablet was what we ended up using) no one noticed us leave or said anything as we got up to leave. This was not a busy night. Only three of us at the bar and two or three tables with customers in the lounge.  While exiting the restaurant the manager or supervisor of the bar was "escorting" a man and his son out. Following them saying "get out of my f*ing restaurant. Go, go" then continued to follow them outside saying "I'll kick your f*ing a** get out of here" and more comments similar that nature. Once outside all the bartenders who had been working followed them outside leaving the bar completely unattended.  The child was calmly leaving and looked completely embarrassed (who wouldn't be). not sure what warranted this behavior on the customers part, however NEVER should any one talk to a customer like that in my opinion. ABSOLUTELY HORRIBLE!

I have been coming to this Red Robin for many years.  Yes it's a chain but the staff is always friendly and patient.  For the amount of volume and loud children this place rocks it! I think one of the better burger spots in Issaquah. Lots of beers on tap.  Bar has at least 10 TVs and plenty of seating for large groups. Lots of parking, clean bathrooms. Good value for the dollar.

Supervisor and server handled a situation where a minor was talking with relatives at the bar and getting rudely kicked out. With phrases like "You need to leave. I don't want to lose my job." When the supervisor was addressed about the issue the customer was still argued against and told that the server's rudeness was brought on by themselves. I worked at a busy restaurant myself and have been in the server's situation myself and never would I have behaved that way. The excuse was there was drop ins by the law enforcement about minors in bars and it was a tense situation. The customer was only a week from being 21.
Unacceptable Red Robin! I have come 3 times in the past six weeks and the milkshake machine is not working still. I am a regular customer, but not after this!

My wife and I noticed a funny smell when we walked in. It was very noticeable to us but the greeters looked at us like we were crazy when we asked about the smell. I even went into the restroom to see if there were issues in their but the restroom smelled way better than the lobby area. It was a busy night so it took a while to get our food. We ordered garlic fries and like usual... there was no noticeable garlic on our fries. There was oil but no garlic. They charged us an extra $3 for garlic and we didn't get garlic. The staff kicked butt. They were very fast to refill our water and tea. They did really well considering how busy it was. My chicken burger was one of the best I've had at RR so that's why I gave 3 stars instead of 2.

Called ahead an order; gal taking our order very nice and read it back to us correctly. It took us 15 min to drive there after the order, then waited another 15 once there in an awkward weird room with many people waiting around for a looonnnng time. We took it home and it was not good. Each of our burgers were labeled as the other's burger so we had to switch. Not a big deal there, but really? Go to the trouble of writing on the order to label it (2 meals) and write it on the wrong ones?... The fries were a problem; We ordered an extra order of fries. That was missing completely, then yikes: In our meals, there were the smallest portion of fries I've ever seen, and they were the butt fries, all the dregs of the fries in other words. None of the good ones. Seriously? Fries are the best part! .... and so the fries were a total wash. Not going back to this Red Robin.

all i wanted was a cookie magic shake because i love those and its been a hard semester and a cookie magic shake would soothe my tormented soul, but they informed me that their shake machine was broken. understandable. i go back a week later in search for the shake. machine still broken, just like my heart.

Cheese sticks without marinara sauce???  All food was really good. Only complaint is that we ordered cheese sticks for an appetizer and they were given to us without marinara sauce. Asked for marinara sauce 3 times and wait staff forgot to give it to us *every* time. You can't eat cheese sticks without marinara sauce. In the end, we gave up asking for the sauce and barely touched the cheese sticks.
